Class ComentarioController

  • Method Details

    • getAllComments

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Comentario>> getAllComments()
      This method is a GET request mapped to the root of the "/api/comentarios" endpoint. It retrieves all comments in the system.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of all comments. The status code is 200 (OK) if the operation is successful.

    • getCommentsBySchoolId

      @GetMapping("/colegio/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Comentario>> getCommentsBySchoolId(@PathVariable Long id)
      This method is a GET request mapped to "/colegio/{id}". It retrieves all comments associated with a specific school identified by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the school for which comments are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of comments associated with the school. The status code is 200 (OK) if the operation is successful.

    • createComment

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Comentario> createComment(@RequestBody Map<String,Object> data)
      This method is a POST request mapped to the root of the "/api/comentarios" endpoint. It creates a new comment in the system.
      Parameters:
      data - A map containing the data for the new comment. The map should contain the following keys: - "usuarioId": The ID of the user who is creating the comment. This should be an Integer. - "colegioId": The ID of the school that the comment is associated with. This should be an Integer. - "contenido": The content of the comment. This should be a String.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the newly created comment. The status code is 201 (Created) if the operation is successful.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the user or school associated with the provided IDs cannot be found.

    • updateComment

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> updateComment(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody Map<String,Object> data)
      This method is a PUT request mapped to "/api/comentarios/{id}". It updates an existing comment in the system.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the comment to be updated. This should be a Long.
      data - A map containing the data for the comment to be updated. The map should contain the following key: - "contenido": The new content of the comment. This should be a String.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a status code of 204 (No Content) if the operation is successful. If the comment associated with the provided ID cannot be found, the status code is 404 (Not Found).

    • deleteComment

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteComment(@PathVariable Long id)
      This method is a DELETE request mapped to "/api/comentarios/{id}". It deletes an existing comment in the system.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the comment to be deleted. This should be a Long.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a status code of 204 (No Content) if the operation is successful. If the comment associated with the provided ID cannot be found, the status code is 404 (Not Found).

    • getCommentsByUserId

      @GetMapping("/usuario/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Comentario>> getCommentsByUserId(@PathVariable Long id)
      This method is a GET request mapped to "/api/comentarios/usuario/{id}". It retrieves all comments associated with a specific user identified by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the user for which comments are to be retrieved. This should be a Long.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of comments associated with the user. The status code is 200 (OK) if the operation is successful.

    • deactivateComment

      @PutMapping("/{id}/deactivate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deactivateComment(@PathVariable Long id)
      This method is a PUT request mapped to "/api/comentarios/{id}/activate". It activates a comment that has been deactivated.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the comment to be activated. This should be a Long.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a status code of 204 (No Content) if the operation is successful. If the comment associated with the provided ID cannot be found, the status code is 404 (Not Found).

    • activateComment

      @PutMapping("/{id}/reactivate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> activateComment(@PathVariable Long id)
      This method is used to activate a Comentario. It first finds the Comentario by its id. If the Comentario is not found, it returns a 404 Not Found status. If the Comentario is found, it sets the active status to true if it's not already true. It then saves the updated Comentario to the data
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the Comentario to be activated. This should be a Long.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity that indicates the status of the operation. If the Comentario is not found, it returns a 404. If the Comentario is activated successfully, it returns a 204.
